meanings.definition: A small, usually prosperous community situated beyond the suburbs of a city.
meanings.sent1: The exurb was a peaceful town with friendly neighbors.
meanings.sent2: Many people prefer living in an exurb for its quiet atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: In the exurb, even the birds seemed to have a relaxed, carefree attitude.
meanings.sent4: The exurb was like a hidden gem, tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
meanings.sent5: The exurb's charm was undeniable, drawing in new residents every year.

meanings.definition: A residential area outside a city or town, especially a wealthy one.
meanings.sent1: The exurb boasted luxurious mansions and well-manicured lawns.
meanings.sent2: Living in an exurb often means enjoying spacious homes and green surroundings.
meanings.sent3: Even the squirrels in the exurb seemed to have a taste for the finer things in life.
meanings.sent4: The exurb shimmered like a jewel in the distance, a beacon of affluence.
meanings.sent5: The exurb's elegance was unmatched, attracting those seeking a high-class lifestyle.
